pros: Small school means you get to offer more input.  In my four years here I've been able to be very hands on as far as curriculum development.
cons:
The company was just sold for the third time in two years.  The current owner lives in China and isn't very aware  of US culture and customs, or just doesn't care.  The department heads are slowly being replaced by chinese.  Unless you speak mandarin, you have no future here.  

The pay is garbage as well.

As far as the media arts department- The department is split into three sections, Game Art, Visual Effects, and Graphic Design.  I don't think any of the department heads have worked in their respective industries in at least 20 years.  I'm not exaggerating here, and it shows.  They've made some very wonky decisions on how certain courses should be taught that put the school behind industry standards.

review_title: Best Job I worked at so far.
pros:
as a student -
1. You have the time to do your homework.
2. The boss works around your schedule and if you need more hours, it is provided for you.
3. The department varies, but the one I work in, you get to help people and as lame as that sounds to some, I like that compare to my old job.
4. If you don't know something, you can always ask a co-worker or your boss, they are always helpful.
5. There are meetings every 3 months and email updates on news.
cons:
As a student -
1. The pay is minimum wage and is only part time.
2. In order to work there, your federal work study has to be approved and there are only a few exceptions where a federal work study is not needed.
3. Hard to find parking due to the business on both sides of the campus.
4. Limited hours, only 20 hours every 2 weeks.

review_title: Good when good, bad when bad
